ScrollView.Label: Before Android 5, CardView adds padding to its content and draws shadows to that area. If you specify exact dimensions for the CardView, because of the shadows, its content area will be different between platforms before 5 and after 5. Set cardUseCompatPadding to true to add padding after after 5 as well for a consistent result. Run with Android 5 or later and tap the label to toggle and see the difference.

Before Android 5, CardView does not clip its children that intersect with rounded corners. Instead, it adds padding. Set cardPreventCornerOverlap to false to disable the padding and have the content overlap any rounded corners. Run with Android 4.x or before and tap the label to toggle and see the difference.
Before Android 5, CardView adds padding to its content and draws a custom shadow implementation to that area to immitate true elevation.

To avoid resizing the content width when you dynamically change te elevation you need to set cardMaxElevation on creation. This will make the padding large enough to contain the maximum shadow size. Run with Android 4.x or before to see the additional padding.
